sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SYNODALS, or Synodies, were pecuniary rents (commonly of two ſhillings), paid to the biſhop, or archdeacon, at the time of their Eaſter viſitation, by every pariſh prieſt. They were thus called, becauſe uſually paid in ſynods ; becauſe anciently biſhops uſed to viſit and hold their dioceſam ſynods once.—For the ſame reaſon, they are ſometimes alſo denominated ſynodalica; but more uſually, procurations.
